description: Findings and circumstances relating to the examination and treatment of a individual
A unique proper name or character sequence that identifies this particular clinical examination
A reference to the individual whom this clinical information is about
The date on which the clinical assement was made
The age of the individual at the time of observation (e.g., "P55Y8M12D")
The kind of visit undertaken by the individual within a study, such as inpatient, outpatient, telephone, baseline, follow up, etc.
This table extends observations with clinical details compatible with phenopacket

The assemblage of traits or outward appearance of an individual. It is the product of interactions between genes and between genes and the environment. In medical context, these are often the symptoms caused by a disease.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard
Gene affected by pathogenic variation that is causal for disease of the individual
Causal variant in HGVS notation with optional classification or free text explaining any other molecular mechanisms involved.
An indication that diagnosis is given and the case is no longer considered unsolved.
The date on which a case was considered solved (i.e., a diagnosis was made)

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients used by the individual intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. Any hormone therapies, gender-related or otherwise, should also be recorded here.
The specific way a therapeutic drug is to be taken, including formulation, route of administration, dose, dosing interval, and treatment duration.
A record of a individual's background regarding health, occurrence of disease events and surgical procedures
The date on which contact with the individual was initiated
The date on which contact with the individual was last made
An individual's classification of functioning i.e. disability profile according to International Classification of Functioning and Disability (ICF)
A description of one or more materials used to make a diagnosis
Beacon v2 Individuals PhenotypicFeatures
A reference to a specific clinical observation (e.g., "Ind001_Phen001")
A term denoting a phenotypic feature. E.g. "Abnormality of body height"

An indication if the phenotype was observed or not. The default is ‘false’, in other words the phenotype was observed. Therefore it is only required in cases to indicate that the phenotype was looked for, but found to be absent.

Additional terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. E.g. Exacerbated by tobacco use
A value that describes the intensity of the phenotype (e.g., "Profound")
History of diagnoses of an individual at a specific timepoints
A reference to a specific clinical observation (e.g., "Ind001_Phen001")
The diagnosis assigned for this particular observation (e.g., "Spinocerebellar ataxia type 34")
A categorical value that groups this individual's age of onset into groups (e.g., "Adult", "18-24 years", etc.)
The age at which manifestations of the diseaese first appeared (e.g., "P32Y6M1D")
A categorical value that groups this individual's age at diagnosis into groups (e.g., "Adult", "18-24 years", etc.)
The age at which the diagnosis was made (e.g., "P32Y6M1D")
An indication if the diagnosis is present in one or more family members or other relatives
A value that describes the intensity of the disease (e.g., "Profound")
A part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease (e.g., "acute onset")
Additional clinical measurements collected as part of the clinical observation
A reference to a specific clinical observation (e.g., "Ind001_Phen001")
A unique code that identifies or categorises this measurement (e.g., "Metabolomics")
A name that describes the measurement (e.g.. "Blood platelet count")
The value that was measured, collected, derived, etc. (e.g. "55345")
A value that specifes the measured value (e.g., "Per Millimeter")
